com.googlecode.komarro
Class TypeLiteral<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.komarro.TypeLiteral<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public abstract class TypeLiteral<T>
extends Object

Specifies an exact type literal along with the generic parameters. As the generic types in java are erased at runtime TypeLiteral exploits the fact that the generic information of the parent classes is maintained at runtime.

This is an abstract class and it is intended to be extended by anonymous classes in a following way:

new TypeLiteral<SomeGenericClass<Parameter>>() {};

For example following declaration allows retaining the information about the types of the map parameters:

new TypeLiteral<Map<String, List<Integer>>>() {};

TypeLiteral also provides a static factory method that is intended to be used to specify non-generic class literals. When declaring a non-generic type literal it is preferable to use the create(Class) factory method.

Author:
marekdec

create

public static <T> TypeLiteral<T> create(Class<T> clazz)
Creates the a TypeLiteral for a non-generic class. This should be used only when a literal for a non-generic class is inteded to be created.
